message.content:
<<<api>>>: File.createNewFile
<<<code>>>: 
public class MyAction extends Action {
    public ActionForward execute(ActionMapping mapping, ActionForm form, HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response) throws Exception {
        MyForm myForm = (MyForm) form;
        String scanData = myForm.getScanData();
        // Write scanData to a text file
        File file = new File("path/to/your/file.txt");
        if (!file.exists()) {
            file.createNewFile();
        }
        FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(file, true);
        writer.write(scanData);
        writer.close();
        // Clear the scanData field
        myForm.setScanData("");
        return mapping.findForward("success");
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, we are creating a new file if it does not exist using the createNewFile() method of the File class. Then, we are writing the scanData to the file using a FileWriter. After writing the data, we are clearing the scanData field by setting it to an empty string. This way, the text box will be cleared and ready for the next user entry.

Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<>>: $API <<>>: $CODE <<>>: $EXPLANATION. Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java? Please using this api: Arrays.stream. Answer:<<>>: Arrays.stream <<>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum(); <<>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation. Question: How to reload a JSP with request.getAttribute values: :I have this application where i want to populate a text file on the basis of entries entered from user interface. I chose Struts1 for this and i have been able to complete most of the functionalities.But the part of keeping on populating the text file on the basis of user entries in my JSP is something i am struggling with. The following are the flow of pages on user interface 1.'Accept user entries' http://www.image-share.com/ijpg-1178-104.html 2.'Ask for scan data on the basis of entries in page1' http://www.image-share.com/ijpg-1178-105.html 3.'Submit after entering the scandata. ' http://www.image-share.com/ijpg-1178-106.html (I have been able to straighten the null values in the images via session variables. Thanks to Dave) message is seen with null entries like this Post validation. My questions is: What should be used so that there is a scenario that the users enter the Scan Data on page 2 and can continue to enter more scan data values by falling back on the same JSP . I was thinking on the lines of reloading the page using JavaScript on the button click. Is it the right approach? The relevant code for this is <% String itemname = (String)session.getAttribute("itemname"); %> <% String lotnumber = (String)session.getAttribute("lotnumber"); %> <% String godownname = (String)session.getAttribute("godownname"); %>
<% String message = (String)session.getAttribute("message"); session.setAttribute( "theFileName", message ); %> Filename : <%= message %>
Item Name :<%= itemname %>
Lot Number :<%= lotnumber %>
Godown Name :<%= godownname %>
